casebody.data:
Melvyn Monroe BROWN, Petitioner-Appellant, v. Louie L. WAINWRIGHT, Director, Division of Corrections, State of Florida, Respondent-Appellee. No. 73-3665

Summary Calendar.*

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Feb. 19, 1974. John R. Lawson, Jr., Tampa, Fla. (Court-appointed), for petitioner-appellant. Robert L. Shevin, Atty. Gen., Tallahassee, Fla., Baya Harrison III, Asst. Atty. Gen., Tampa, Fla., for respondent-appellee. Henry E. Williams, Jr., City Atty., Gerald H. Bee, Asst. City Atty., Tampa, Fla., amicus curiae for Halloway and Baker.

Before COLEMAN, DYER and RO-NEY, Circuit Judges.

Rule 18, 5 Cir.; see Isbell Enterprises, Inc. v. Citizens Casualty Company of New York et al., 5 Cir., 1970, 431 F.2d 409, Part I.

 PER CURIAM:

The sole issue in this habeas corpus appeal is the timeliness of the application for a search warrant. The District Court denied relief. This subject was fully explored in Bastida v. Henderson, [1973] 5th Cir., 487 F.2d 860. Upon the authority of Bastida, the judgment of the District Court is Affirmed.
